cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-northwest, cross the Yucatan Channel/Peninsula Monday, then move north over the southern Gulf and curve northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast mid-week

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, and U.S. northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Minimal risk of tropical-storm-force wind (≤3% chance of 34-kt winds in 5 days)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late week as remnants pass inland, with localized nuisance flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential minor river rises and increased barge current upriver if heavy upstream rainfall occurs
